summary: This is a Bureau of Prisons medical emergency report and clinical encounter documenting the response to Jeffrey Epstein being found unresponsive in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center on August 10, 2019. It details the CPR and resuscitation efforts performed by correctional officers and medical staff before Epstein was transported to a local emergency room.

persons.name: Jeffrey Edward Epstein
persons.context: The inmate found unresponsive in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, subject of the medical emergency and resuscitation efforts.

persons.name: Bola RN
persons.context: Listed as a team member/provider during the resuscitation event encounter.

persons.name: Iyat Maio
persons.context: Listed as performing CPR compressions during the code events.

connections.description: Clinical nurse Ja reports the medical emergency to Captain Ma via memorandum.
Clinical nurse Ja responded to the medical emergency for inmate Epstein and documented the incident.
RN Bola was part of the medical team providing resuscitation efforts for Epstein.
Iyat Maio performed CPR compressions on Epstein during the resuscitation event.

events.title: Epstein Found Unresponsive in Cell
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive on the floor of his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center with CPR in progress by correctional officers.

events.title: Resuscitation Efforts
events.description: Medical staff performed extensive resuscitation including CPR, AED placement, intubation, and administration of epinephrine and sodium bicarbonate.

events.title: Transport to Emergency Room
events.description: Epstein was transported to a local emergency room with CPR still in progress after failed resuscitation attempts at the facility.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, New York
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at approximately 6:33 AM on August 10, 2019.
Epstein had 'circumferential bruising around the neck and posterior mottling' when found.
Medical staff noted Epstein was cold, with fixed and dilated pupils, and no palpable pulses upon arrival.
Resuscitation efforts included CPR, AED placement (no shock advised), intubation, and administration of epinephrine and sodium bicarbonate.
Epstein was transported to a local emergency room with CPR still in progress at approximately 7:10 AM.
